title: Ticket #5810: After shared_port restart, master should send update w/o addresses.
description:
Currently, immediately after the master restarts the shared port daemon, it will send an update ad (indicating that the shared port daemon is down). That update ad -- because the shared port daemon is down and the way the fix to the rewrite code works -- will contain an old* and not-rewritten address. Instead, it should contain no addressing information at all, as it would if a condor_reconfig were issued while it was waiting for the shared port daemon's address file. This more accurately and consistently reflect the actual situation.

* : Old is probably OK -- the shared port daemon's port will generally be fixed except in personal condors -- but not-rewritten could be bad (since address rewriting is necessary for backwards compatibility).
